00038 #include <getopt.h>
00039 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00040 #include <time.h>

00042 #include "obdctl.h"

00044 #include <lustre/lustre_lfsck_user.h>

00047 /* Needs to be last to avoid clashes */
00048 #include <libcfs/util/ioctl.h>
00049 
00050 static struct option long_opt_start[] = {
00051         {"device",              required_argument, 0, 'M'},
00052         {"all",                 no_argument,       0, 'A'},
00053         {"create_ostobj",       optional_argument, 0, 'c'},
00054         {"create_mdtobj",       optional_argument, 0, 'C'},
00055         {"error",               required_argument, 0, 'e'},
00056         {"help",                no_argument,       0, 'h'},
00057         {"dryrun",              optional_argument, 0, 'n'},
00058         {"orphan",              no_argument,       0, 'o'},
00059         {"reset",               no_argument,       0, 'r'},
00060         {"speed",               required_argument, 0, 's'},
00061         {"type",                required_argument, 0, 't'},
00062         {"window_size",         required_argument, 0, 'w'},
00063         {0,                     0,                 0,  0 }
00064 };
00065 
00066 static struct option long_opt_stop[] = {
00067         {"device",      required_argument, 0, 'M'},
00068         {"all",         no_argument,       0, 'A'},
00069         {"help",        no_argument,       0, 'h'},
00070         {0,             0,                 0,  0 }
00071 };
00072 
00073 static struct option long_opt_query[] = {
00074         {"device",      required_argument, 0, 'M'},
00075         {"type",        required_argument, 0, 't'},
00076         {"help",        no_argument,       0, 'h'},
00077         {"wait",        no_argument,       0, 'w'},
00078         {0,             0,                 0,  0 }
00079 };
00080 
00081 struct lfsck_type_name {
00082         char            *ltn_name;
00083         enum lfsck_type  ltn_type;
00084 };
00085 
00086 static struct lfsck_type_name lfsck_types_names[] = {
00087         { "scrub",      LFSCK_TYPE_SCRUB },
00088         { "layout",     LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT },
00089         { "namespace",  LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE },
00090         { "default",    LFSCK_TYPES_DEF },
00091         { "all",        LFSCK_TYPES_SUPPORTED },
00092         { NULL,         0 }
00093 };
00094 
00095 static enum lfsck_type lfsck_name2type(const char *name)
00096 {
00097         int i;
00098 
00099         for (i = 0; lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name != NULL; i++) {
00100                 if (strcmp(lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name, name) == 0)
00101                         return lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_type;
00102         }
00103         return -1;
00104 }
00105 
00106 static const char *lfsck_type2name(__u16 type)
00107 {
00108         int i;
00109 
00110         for (i = 0; lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name != NULL; i++) {
00111                 if (type == lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_type)
00112                         return lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name;
00113         }
00114 
00115         return NULL;
00116 }
00117 
00118 static void usage_start(void)
00119 {
00120         fprintf(stderr, "start LFSCK\n"
00121                 "usage:\n"
00122                 "lfsck_start <-M | --device {MDT,OST}_device>\n"
00123                 "            [-A | --all] [-c | --create_ostobj [on | off]]\n"
00124                 "            [-C | --create_mdtobj [on | off]]\n"
00125                 "            [-e | --error {continue | abort}] [-h | --help]\n"
00126                 "            [-n | --dryrun [on | off]] [-o | --orphan]\n"
00127                 "            [-r | --reset] [-s | --speed ops_per_sec_limit]\n"
00128                 "            [-t | --type check_type[,check_type...]]\n"
00129                 "            [-w | --window_size size]\n"
00130                 "options:\n"
00131                 "-M: device to start LFSCK/scrub on\n"
00132                 "-A: start LFSCK on all MDT devices\n"
00133                 "-c: create the lost OST-object for dangling LOV EA "
00134                     "(default 'off', or 'on')\n"
00135                 "-C: create the lost MDT-object for dangling name entry "
00136                     "(default 'off', or 'on')\n"
00137                 "-e: error handle mode (default 'continue', or 'abort')\n"
00138                 "-h: this help message\n"
00139                 "-n: check with no modification (default 'off', or 'on')\n"
00140                 "-o: repair orphan OST-objects\n"
00141                 "-r: reset scanning to the start of the device\n"
00142                 "-s: maximum items to be scanned per second "
00143                     "(default '%d' = no limit)\n"
00144                 "-t: check type(s) to be performed (default all)\n"
00145                 "-w: window size for async requests pipeline\n",
00146                 LFSCK_SPEED_NO_LIMIT);
00147 }
00148 
00149 static void usage_stop(void)
00150 {
00151         fprintf(stderr, "stop LFSCK\n"
00152                 "usage:\n"
00153                 "lfsck_stop <-M | --device {MDT,OST}_device>\n"
00154                 "           [-A | --all] [-h | --help]\n"
00155                 "options:\n"
00156                 "-M: device to stop LFSCK/scrub on\n"
00157                 "-A: stop LFSCK on all MDT devices\n"
00158                 "-h: this help message\n");
00159 }
00160 
00161 static void usage_query(void)
00162 {
00163         fprintf(stderr, "check the LFSCK global status\n"
00164                 "usage:\n"
00165                 "lfsck_query <-M | --device MDT_device> [-h | --help]\n"
00166                 "            [-t | --type check_type[,check_type...]]\n"
00167                 "            [-t | --wait]\n"
00168                 "options:\n"
00169                 "-M: device to query LFSCK on\n"
00170                 "-t: LFSCK type(s) to be queried (default is all)\n"
00171                 "-h: this help message\n"
00172                 "-w: do not return until LFSCK not running\n");
00173 }
00174 
00175 static int lfsck_pack_dev(struct obd_ioctl_data *data, char *device, char *arg)
00176 {
00177         int len = strlen(arg) + 1;
00178 
00179         if (len > MAX_OBD_NAME) {
00180                 fprintf(stderr, "device name is too long. "
00181                         "Valid length should be less than %d\n", MAX_OBD_NAME);
00182                 return -EINVAL;
00183         }
00184 
00185         memcpy(device, arg, len);
00186         data->ioc_inlbuf4 = device;
00187         data->ioc_inllen4 = len;
00188         data->ioc_dev = OBD_DEV_BY_DEVNAME;
00189         return 0;
00190 }
00191 
00192 int jt_lfsck_start(int argc, char **argv)
00193 {
00194         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00195         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00196         char device[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00197         struct lfsck_start start;
00198         char *optstring = "Ac::C::e:hM:n::ors:t:w:";
00199         int opt, index, rc, val, i;
00200 
00201         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00202         memset(&start, 0, sizeof(start));
00203         memset(device, 0, MAX_OBD_NAME);
00204         start.ls_version = LFSCK_VERSION_V1;
00205         start.ls_active = LFSCK_TYPES_ALL;
00206 
00207         /* Reset the 'optind' for the case of getopt_long() called multiple
00208          * times under the same lctl. */
00209         optind = 0;
00210         while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, optstring, long_opt_start,
00211                                   &index)) != EOF) {
00212                 switch (opt) {
00213                 case 'A':
00214                         start.ls_flags |= LPF_ALL_TGT | LPF_BROADCAST;
00215                         break;
00216                 case 'c':
00217                         if (optarg == NULL || strcmp(optarg, "on") == 0) {
00218                                 start.ls_flags |= LPF_CREATE_OSTOBJ;
00219                         } else if (strcmp(optarg, "off") != 0) {
00220                                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid switch: -c '%s'. "
00221                                         "valid switches are:\n"
00222                                         "empty ('on'), or 'off' without space. "
00223                                         "For example:\n"
00224                                         "'-c', '-con', '-coff'\n", optarg);
00225                                 return -EINVAL;
00226                         }
00227                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_CREATE_OSTOBJ;
00228                         break;
00229                 case 'C':
00230                         if (optarg == NULL || strcmp(optarg, "on") == 0) {
00231                                 start.ls_flags |= LPF_CREATE_MDTOBJ;
00232                         } else if (strcmp(optarg, "off") != 0) {
00233                                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid switch: -C '%s'. "
00234                                         "valid switches are:\n"
00235                                         "empty ('on'), or 'off' without space. "
00236                                         "For example:\n"
00237                                         "'-C', '-Con', '-Coff'\n", optarg);
00238                                 return -EINVAL;
00239                         }
00240                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_CREATE_MDTOBJ;
00241                         break;
00242                 case 'e':
00243                         if (strcmp(optarg, "abort") == 0) {
00244                                 start.ls_flags |= LPF_FAILOUT;
00245                         } else if (strcmp(optarg, "continue") != 0) {
00246                                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid error mode: -e '%s'."
00247                                         "valid modes are: "
00248                                         "'continue' or 'abort'.\n", optarg);
00249                                 return -EINVAL;
00250                         }
00251                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_ERROR_HANDLE;
00252                         break;
00253                 case 'h':
00254                         usage_start();
00255                         return 0;
00256                 case 'M':
00257                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, optarg);
00258                         if (rc != 0)
00259                                 return rc;
00260                         break;
00261                 case 'n':
00262                         if (optarg == NULL || strcmp(optarg, "on") == 0) {
00263                                 start.ls_flags |= LPF_DRYRUN;
00264                         } else if (strcmp(optarg, "off") != 0) {
00265                                 fprintf(stderr, "invalid switch: -n '%s'. "
00266                                         "valid switches are:\n"
00267                                         "empty ('on'), or 'off' without space. "
00268                                         "For example:\n"
00269                                         "'-n', '-non', '-noff'\n", optarg);
00270                                 return -EINVAL;
00271                         }
00272                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_DRYRUN;
00273                         break;
00274                 case 'o':
00275                         start.ls_flags |= LPF_ALL_TGT | LPF_BROADCAST |
00276                                           LPF_OST_ORPHAN;
00277                         break;
00278                 case 'r':
00279                         start.ls_flags |= LPF_RESET;
00280                         break;
00281                 case 's':
00282                         val = atoi(optarg);
00283                         start.ls_speed_limit = val;
00284                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_SPEED_LIMIT;
00285                         break;
00286                 case 't': {
00287                         char *typename;
00288 
00289                         if (start.ls_active == LFSCK_TYPES_ALL)
00290                                 start.ls_active = 0;
00291                         while ((typename = strsep(&optarg, ",")) != NULL) {
00292                                 enum lfsck_type type;
00293 
00294                                 type = lfsck_name2type(typename);
00295                                 if (type == -1)
00296                                         goto bad_type;
00297                                 start.ls_active |= type;
00298                         }
00299                         break;
00300 bad_type:
00301                         fprintf(stderr, "invalid check type -t '%s'. "
00302                                 "valid types are:\n", typename);
00303                         for (i = 0; lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name != NULL; i++)
00304                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s%s", i != 0 ? "," : "",
00305                                         lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name);
00306                         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00307                         return -EINVAL;
00308                 }
00309                 case 'w':
00310                         val = atoi(optarg);
00311                         if (val < 1 || val > LFSCK_ASYNC_WIN_MAX) {
00312                                 fprintf(stderr,
00313                                         "Invalid async window size that "
00314                                         "may cause memory issues. The valid "
00315                                         "range is [1 - %u].\n",
00316                                         LFSCK_ASYNC_WIN_MAX);
00317                                 return -EINVAL;
00318                         }
00319 
00320                         start.ls_async_windows = val;
00321                         start.ls_valid |= LSV_ASYNC_WINDOWS;
00322                         break;
00323                 default:
00324                         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid option, '-h' for help.\n");
00325                         return -EINVAL;
00326                 }
00327         }
00328 
00329         if (start.ls_active == LFSCK_TYPES_ALL)
00330                 start.ls_active = LFSCK_TYPES_DEF;
00331 
00332         if (data.ioc_inlbuf4 == NULL) {
00333                 if (lcfg_get_devname() != NULL) {
00334                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, lcfg_get_devname());
00335                         if (rc != 0)
00336                                 return rc;
00337                 } else {
00338                         fprintf(stderr,
00339                                 "Must specify device to start LFSCK.\n");
00340                         return -EINVAL;
00341                 }
00342         }
00343 
00344         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&start;
00345         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(start);
00346         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00347         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00348         if (rc != 0) {
00349                 fprintf(stderr, "Fail to pack ioctl data: rc = %d.\n", rc);
00350                 return rc;
00351         }
00352 
00353         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_START_LFSCK, buf);
00354         if (rc < 0) {
00355                 perror("Fail to start LFSCK");
00356                 return rc;
00357         }
00358 
00359         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00360         printf("Started LFSCK on the device %s: scrub", device);
00361         for (i = 0; lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name != NULL; i++) {
00362                 if (start.ls_active & lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_type) {
00363                         printf(" %s", lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name);
00364                         start.ls_active &= ~lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_type;
00365                 }
00366         }
00367         if (start.ls_active != 0)
00368                 printf(" unknown(0x%x)", start.ls_active);
00369         printf("\n");
00370 
00371         return 0;
00372 }
00373 
00374 int jt_lfsck_stop(int argc, char **argv)
00375 {
00376         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00377         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00378         char device[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00379         struct lfsck_stop stop;
00380         char *optstring = "AhM:";
00381         int opt, index, rc;
00382 
00383         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00384         memset(&stop, 0, sizeof(stop));
00385         memset(device, 0, MAX_OBD_NAME);
00386 
00387         /* Reset the 'optind' for the case of getopt_long() called multiple
00388          * times under the same lctl. */
00389         optind = 0;
00390         while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, optstring, long_opt_stop,
00391                                   &index)) != EOF) {
00392                 switch (opt) {
00393                 case 'A':
00394                         stop.ls_flags |= LPF_ALL_TGT | LPF_BROADCAST;
00395                         break;
00396                 case 'h':
00397                         usage_stop();
00398                         return 0;
00399                 case 'M':
00400                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, optarg);
00401                         if (rc != 0)
00402                                 return rc;
00403                         break;
00404                 default:
00405                         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid option, '-h' for help.\n");
00406                         return -EINVAL;
00407                 }
00408         }
00409 
00410         if (data.ioc_inlbuf4 == NULL) {
00411                 if (lcfg_get_devname() != NULL) {
00412                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, lcfg_get_devname());
00413                         if (rc != 0)
00414                                 return rc;
00415                 } else {
00416                         fprintf(stderr,
00417                                 "Must specify device to stop LFSCK.\n");
00418                         return -EINVAL;
00419                 }
00420         }
00421 
00422         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&stop;
00423         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(stop);
00424         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00425         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00426         if (rc != 0) {
00427                 fprintf(stderr, "Fail to pack ioctl data: rc = %d.\n", rc);
00428                 return rc;
00429         }
00430 
00431         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_STOP_LFSCK, buf);
00432         if (rc < 0) {
00433                 perror("Fail to stop LFSCK");
00434                 return rc;
00435         }
00436 
00437         printf("Stopped LFSCK on the device %s.\n", device);
00438         return 0;
00439 }
00440 
00441 int jt_lfsck_query(int argc, char **argv)
00442 {
00443         struct obd_ioctl_data data = { 0 };
00444         char rawbuf[MAX_IOC_BUFLEN], *buf = rawbuf;
00445         char device[MAX_OBD_NAME] = "";
00446         struct lfsck_query query = { .lu_types = LFSCK_TYPES_ALL };
00447         int opt, index, rc, i;
00448         enum lfsck_type type;
00449 
00450         while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, "hM:t:w", long_opt_query,
00451                                   &index)) != EOF) {
00452                 switch (opt) {
00453                 case 'h':
00454                         usage_query();
00455                         return 0;
00456                 case 'M':
00457                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, optarg);
00458                         if (rc != 0)
00459                                 return rc;
00460                         break;
00461                 case 't': {
00462                         char *typename;
00463 
00464                         if (query.lu_types == LFSCK_TYPES_ALL)
00465                                 query.lu_types = 0;
00466                         while ((typename = strsep(&optarg, ",")) != NULL) {
00467                                 type = lfsck_name2type(typename);
00468                                 if (type == -1)
00469                                         goto bad_type;
00470                                 query.lu_types |= type;
00471                         }
00472                         break;
00473 
00474 bad_type:
00475                         fprintf(stderr, "invalid LFSCK type -t '%s'. "
00476                                 "valid types are:\n", typename);
00477                         for (i = 0; lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name != NULL; i++)
00478                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s%s", i != 0 ? "," : "",
00479                                         lfsck_types_names[i].ltn_name);
00480                         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00481                         return -EINVAL;
00482                 }
00483                 case 'w':
00484                         query.lu_flags |= LPF_WAIT;
00485                         break;
00486                 default:
00487                         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid option, '-h' for help.\n");
00488                         usage_query();
00489                         return -EINVAL;
00490                 }
00491         }
00492 
00493         if (data.ioc_inlbuf4 == NULL) {
00494                 if (lcfg_get_devname() != NULL) {
00495                         rc = lfsck_pack_dev(&data, device, lcfg_get_devname());
00496                         if (rc != 0)
00497                                 return rc;
00498                 } else {
00499                         fprintf(stderr,
00500                                 "Must specify device to query LFSCK.\n");
00501                         return -EINVAL;
00502                 }
00503         }
00504 
00505         data.ioc_inlbuf1 = (char *)&query;
00506         data.ioc_inllen1 = sizeof(query);
00507         memset(buf, 0, sizeof(rawbuf));
00508         rc = obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00509         if (rc != 0) {
00510                 fprintf(stderr, "Fail to pack ioctl data: rc = %d.\n", rc);
00511                 return rc;
00512         }
00513 
00514         rc = l_ioctl(OBD_DEV_ID, OBD_IOC_QUERY_LFSCK, buf);
00515         if (rc < 0) {
00516                 perror("Fail to query LFSCK");
00517                 return rc;
00518         }
00519 
00520         obd_ioctl_unpack(&data, buf, sizeof(rawbuf));
00521         for (i = 0, type = 1 << i; i < LFSCK_TYPE_BITS; i++, type = 1 << i) {
00522                 const char *name;
00523                 int j;
00524 
00525                 if (!(query.lu_types & type))
00526                         continue;
00527 
00528                 name = lfsck_type2name(type);
00529                 for (j = 0; j <= LS_MAX; j++)
00530                         printf("%s_mdts_%s: %d\n", name,
00531                                lfsck_status2name(j), query.lu_mdts_count[i][j]);
00532 
00533                 for (j = 0; j <= LS_MAX; j++)
00534                         printf("%s_osts_%s: %d\n", name,
00535                                lfsck_status2name(j), query.lu_osts_count[i][j]);
00536 
00537                 printf("%s_repaired: %llu\n", name, query.lu_repaired[i]);
00538         }
00539 
00540         return 0;
00541 }
